greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Zigzag modulo 3.
comment: a(a(n))=n (self-inverse permutation); for n>1: a(n) = n iff n == 0 modulo 3.
Take natural numbers, exchange trisections starting with 2 and 4.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Alternating Permutations
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,1,-1).
formula: a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-3) - a(n-4) for n > 5. - _Chai Wah Wu_, May 25 2016
For n > 1, a(n) = n - (4/sqrt(3))*sin(2*n*Pi/3). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Sep 29 2017
mathematica: a[n_] := n + Mod[n, 3]*(3*Mod[n, 3] - 5); a[1] = 1; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 69}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 04 2011 *)
program: a074066_list = 1 : xs where xs = 4 : 3 : 2 : map (+ 3) xs
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 17 2002
